Title: Multiscale reorganization of the genome following DNA damage facilitates chromosome translocations via nuclear actin polymerization
Summary: Here the authors report a genomic view of 3D chromatin reorganization following DNA damage. Movement of damaged DNA into nuclear domains, which is brought about by nuclear actin, favors error-free damage repair at the expense of rare chromosome rearrangements with oncogenic potential.

Title: Functional crosstalk between the cohesin loader and chromatin remodelers
Summary: Chromatin remodelers direct the cohesin loader to nucleosome depleted regions where cohesin accesses chromosomes. Muñoz et al. now show that the cohesin loader in turn is a biochemical activator of a chromatin remodeler, helping to clear nucleosomes

Title: Exon junction complex shapes the m6A epitranscriptome
Summary: Here the authors show the exon junction complex (EJC) component, EIF4A3, locally restricts METTL3- mediated mRNA methylation at exon junctions to explain the observed widespread enrichment of m6A modification in 3’ untranslated regions.

Title: Polλ promotes microhomology-mediated end-joining
Summary: Chandramouly et al. discover that human Polλ exhibits robust microhomology-mediated end-joining (MMEJ) activity like PolΦ. Polλ promotes MMEJ in mammalian cells independently of essential nonhomologous end-joining factors LIG4/XRCC4 and Polq, which indicates a distinct Polλ-dependent MMEJ mechanism.

Title: R-loop-derived cytoplasmic RNA–DNA hybrids activate an immune response
Summary: RNA–DNA hybrids are immunogenic species that can aberrantly accumulate in the cytoplasm after R-loop processing, linking R-loop accumulation to cell death through the innate immune response.

Title: Nano3P-seq: transcriptome-wide analysis of gene expression and tail dynamics using end-capture nanopore cDNA sequencing
Summary: Nano3P-seq presents a nanopore-based sequencing tool to profile polyA-tailed and non-polyA-tailed transcripts, as well as capture polyA tail length and composition.

Title: ER-associated RNA silencing promotes ER quality control
Summary: Efstathiou et al. describe an Argonaute-dependent endoplasmic reticulum (ER)-associated RNA silencing pathway that acts together with ER-associated protein degradation to preserve ER homeostasis and function.

Title: Global landscape of replicative DNA polymerase usage in the human genome
Summary: Profiling of human DNA polymerase Polε and Polα demonstrates their roles in leading and lagging strand DNA synthesis, and their independent measures allowed accurate predictions of replication dynamics and effects of transcription.

Title: Age-dependent Lamin changes induce cardiac dysfunction via dysregulation of cardiac transcriptional programs
Summary: Kirkland et al. identify conserved age-dependent nuclear remodeling in Drosophila cardiomyocytes, dependent on declining Lamin C. They show that Lamin C loss induces reversible heart dysfunction by repressing myogenic transcription factors.

Title: Deciphering the mechanical code of the genome and epigenome
Summary: Basu and colleagues comprehensively characterize how sequence and epigenetic modifications impact the local mechanical properties of DNA. The results suggest that DNA mechanics may have evolved to aid diverse DNA-deforming biological processes.
